content: During the green revolution, the State positioned itself as the custodian and distributor of scientific progress, says Abhinav Tyagi, science historian and former research fellow at NCBS Archives. He presented a talk on ‚ÄòRevisiting the Green Revolution: Statecraft of cultivating modernity‚Äô in Bengaluru

title: M.R. Srinivasan, former Atomic Energy Commission Chairman, passes away¬†
content: Srinivasan worked alongside Homi Bhabha on the construction of India‚Äôs first nuclear research reactor, Apsara, which achieved criticality in August 1956

title: Tamil Nadu government doctors seek WHO intervention on staffing and pay disparities
content: The committee has requested the WHO to urge the Tamil Nadu government to ensure appropriate staffing in hospitals and implement salary parity in accordance with the relevant government orders and national recommendations

title: Calcutta High Court issues contempt rule against Trinamool Congress leader Kunal Ghosh, seven others
content: Chief Justice of the Calcutta High Court, T.S. Sivagnanam has taken suo motu cognisance of the matter involving the heckling of lawyers, including senior advocate Bikash Ranjan Bhattacharya and has constituted a special three-judge Bench for the hearing.

title: Elephants kill three villagers in M.P.‚Äôs Shahdol; CM orders probe, announces aid
content: A forest officer said that two wild elephants from the neighbouring Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve are believed to have killed the locals

content: Siddaramaiah hopes to break the record of being the longest-serving Chief Minister of Karnataka, held by D. Devaraj Urs

title: Fadnavis slams SLBC for not taking action against those seeking CIBIL score from farmers
content: Urging the SLBC to take action against all those bank branches that continue to seek CIBIL scores from the farmers, the Chief Minister said that the practice continues in the State despite previous FIRs in the matter

title: No maintenance if divorce granted on the ground of adultery, says Chhattisgarh HC
content: Both applicants had solemnised their marriage in July 2019 and the woman alleged that after a few days of marriage, she was subjected to mental torture and her character questioned by the husband

title: Panel discussion held to seek justice for Rohingya refugees
content: Human rights lawyers Prashant Bhushan, Colin Gonsalves, and social activist Harsh Mander were present at the panel discussion in the national capital along with journalist Pamela Philipose, human rights activist Rita Manchanda and social worker Priyali Sur

title: Odisha to identify Bangladeshis, disengage them from jobs in State
content: Government to initially focus on six coastal districts and later expand the exercise to the entire State

title: Supreme Court sets timelines to facilitate repair of Mullaperiyar dam, tree-felling near site
content: On noting that Kerala had consented to the transportation of materials required for six of the nine repair works pointed out by Tamil Nadu, the apex court said there was hardly any ‚Äújustification‚Äù to not allow the transportation of material required for the remaining three works.

title: Jaishankar holds wide-ranging discussions with Dutch counterpart on deepening bilateral partnership
content: The External Affairs Minister appreciated the Netherlands‚Äô strong condemnation of the Pahalgam attack and support for zero tolerance against terrorism.

title: Cyber fraud complaints of over ‚Çπ10 lakh, lodged via helpline or portal, to automatically convert into FIRs
content: The e-Zero FIR initiative has been launched on a pilot basis first in Delhi; complaints have to be registered on the 1930 helpline or cybercrime.gov.in portal

title: Supreme Court grants interim relief to DICCI in sanitation scheme case
content: Bench led by CJI Gavai keeps high court order in abeyance; directs impleadment of DICCI before further hearing

title: YouTuber, trader, student, security guard: 12 'spies' come from all walks of life
content: Indian authorities have arrested at least 12 individuals across Punjab, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh for alleged espionage linked to Pakistan. The suspects, including a YouTuber, are accused of sharing sensitive information with Pakistani Intelligence Operatives. Investigations revealed contact with a Pakistani official at the Pakistan High Commission in Delhi, who has since been expelled.

title: Senior Jharkhand IAS officer arrested in liquor scam case
content: Jharkhand IAS officer Vinay Kumar Choubey was arrested by Chhattisgarh's anti-corruption bureau in connection with a liquor scam. An FIR was filed against Choubey for allegedly causing financial losses to Jharkhand's exchequer by altering the state's liquor policy. The syndicate allegedly manipulated tender norms to favor certain companies, earning illegal commissions.

title: JPMorgan Chase to managers: 'Resist hiring, remember attrition ‚Ä¶ '
content: JPMorgan Chase is implementing a hiring slowdown, prioritizing efficiency gains through artificial intelligence. The bank anticipates a 10% reduction in operations staff due to AI advancements in areas like fraud and payment processing. While overall headcount growth is being curbed, strategic hiring will continue in key areas such as banking, advising, and branch expansion.

title: 'Pant's problems can be fixed in five minutes': Ex-India cricketer's big claim
content: Rishabh Pant's struggles continued as Lucknow Super Giants were eliminated from IPL 2025 playoff contention after a loss to Sunrisers Hyderabad. Pant's poor form, scoring only 7 runs, has drawn criticism. However, Yograj Singh believes Pant's technical flaws are easily fixable, while Pant attributes the team's struggles to injuries of key bowlers.

title: Briefing foreign nations on Op Sindoor before Parliament unacceptable: D Raja
content: CPI leader D Raja criticises the government's briefing of foreign countries on Operation Sindoor while keeping Indians uninformed, demanding a special Parliament session. He questions the lack of consultation with political parties regarding the all-party delegations and raises concerns about suppressed dissent, citing the arrest of an Ashoka University professor.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of its Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: Ashoka University prof Ali Khan sent to judicial custody over post on Op Sindoor
content: Professor Ali Khan Mahmoodabad of Ashoka University has been remanded to judicial custody until May 27 following his arrest over a social media post concerning 'Operation Sindoor.' Two FIRs were filed against him, prompting the Haryana women‚Äôs commission to issue a notice.

title: IPL 2025 final to be played in Ahmedabad: Report
content: Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium will host the IPL 2025 final on June 3, a decision made by the BCCI due to weather considerations. Qualifier 2 will also be held in Ahmedabad on June 1. Mullanpur, New Chandigarh, is likely to host Qualifier 1 and the Eliminator on May 29 and 30 respectively.

title: Microsoft's fired AI director to 6,000 laid off employees: "These are people who‚Ä¶"
content: Microsoft recently laid off approximately 6,000 employees, impacting various levels and teams. Gabriela de Queiroz, Director of AI for Startups, was among those affected, expressing sadness but maintaining a positive outlook. The layoffs coincide with Microsoft's aggressive push into AI, even as software engineers and AI leadership roles were impacted by the cuts.

title: Nifty ends below 24,700 - top 5 reasons market fell
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, tanked in trade on Tuesday afternoon, influenced by subdued global market conditions, selling pressure, and reserved approach from institutional investors.

title: Major telecom outage hits Spain, weeks after electricity blackout
content: A major communication breakdown hit Spain on Tuesday, disrupting internet and landline services nationwide. Thousands of Movistar and O2 customers, both under Telef√≥nica, experienced fibre optic connectivity loss. The widespread outage even impacted emergency response systems, forcing authorities to issue alternative contact numbers as the national '112' line was affected.

title: Preity Zinta lashes out over edited image with young RR star
content: Preity Zinta, co-owner of Punjab Kings, has condemned a fabricated image circulating online that falsely depicts her hugging Rajasthan Royals' young player, Vaibhav Suryavanshi. Zinta refuted the morphed image as fake news, expressing surprise that news channels were also using it. The actual video shows a brief greeting and handshake between Zinta and Suryavanshi.

title: Long before Jyoti, Pak had honey-trapped Madhuri
content: The arrest of YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra for allegedly sharing military secrets with Pakistan has echoes of the Madhuri Gupta case. Gupta, an Indian diplomat in Islamabad, was arrested in 2010 for espionage. She was honey-trapped by Pakistani intelligence, passing sensitive information after being manipulated by promises of love.

title: Who is Dr. Kevin O'Connor, the doc under fire for Biden's cancer diagnosis?
content: Former President Joe Biden's recent prostate cancer diagnosis, which has spread to his bones, has sparked controversy surrounding his former White House physician, Dr. Kevin O'Connor.

title: 'Save Indian cricket': Yograj urges Rohit, Kohli to reconsider Test retirement
content: Yograj Singh voices apprehension over Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's potential Test retirements, emphasizing the necessity of their experience for the upcoming series against England. He urges them to reconsider, highlighting the importance of national pride and fan emotions. Yograj also calls on the BCCI to support players during tough times, referencing past instances of abrupt player dismissals.

title: Bangladeshi actress, Nusraat Faria, charged with attempted murder, gets bail
content: Bangladeshi actress Nusraat Faria, recognized for her roles in several films, was arrested at Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport in Dhaka on charges related to an attempted murder case. She was reportedly on her way to Thailand when authorities detained her. Subsequently, Nusraat Faria has been granted bail by Dhaka Chief Metropolitan Magistrate Court Judge Mostafizur Rahman after submitting a statement.

title: Centre urges Supreme Court to confine waqf hearing to three issue
content: The Centre has urged the Supreme Court to limit hearings on pleas challenging the Waqf Act's validity to three specific issues, for which it has already submitted a comprehensive affidavit. These issues concern the denotification of waqf properties, the composition of waqf boards, and the treatment of waqf property when its status as government land is being investigated.

title: Brian Williams, ex-Texas A&M safety, dies of heat stroke after half marathon
content: Brian Williams, a former Texas A&M safety, passed away at 24. He suffered a severe heat stroke after a half marathon. Williams played for the Aggies for three seasons. He earned his engineering degree in 2024. Tributes poured in from family, friends, and former teammates. Heat stroke occurs when the body overheats, often during physical activity in hot weather.

title: Peppa Pig‚Äôs family just got bigger: Sweet meaning behind baby sister‚Äôs name
content: After much anticipation, Peppa Pig's family has welcomed a new member, Evie. The arrival was celebrated with royal-inspired fanfare, complete with a town crier and official birth certificate. Mummy Pig shared the emotional significance behind the name, revealing it was chosen in honor of her Great Aunt, while also highlighting its meaning of 'life' and 'living one'.

title: Kharge again claims PM had intel on Pahalgam: 'Why didn't you tell tourists?'
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge has criticized the Modi government for alleged security lapses in Pahalgam, claiming negligence led to the deaths of 26 tourists. Speaking at a rally in Karnataka, Kharge questioned why the government didn't advise tourists against visiting the area.

title: Benefit for India: How Indian ports will gain from China+1 strategy - Moody‚Äôs explains
content: Indian ports are set to benefit from the global China+1 strategy as companies diversify manufacturing beyond China, according to Moody's Ratings. This shift could significantly boost port activity in India.

title: Samson breaks silence: 'Last time when Dhoni came out to bat ... '
content: Sanju Samson spoke about MS Dhoni's impact. He recalled the electrifying atmosphere when Dhoni batted in Chennai. Samson admitted the 'Dhoni effect' transcends venues. CSK prepares for their final match against RR. Stephen Fleming remained tight-lipped about Dhoni‚Äôs future. The season has been underwhelming for CSK. Rajasthan Royals have faced missed opportunities. Samson‚Äôs words remind everyone of Dhoni's magical presence.

title: Explained: Why CBSE's new sugar boards are a timely wake-up call
content: To combat rising health issues among students, the CBSE has introduced 'Sugar Boards' in Indian schools. These visually engaging displays will educate children about the dangers of excessive sugar intake, highlighting the sugar content in common snacks and healthier alternatives. Schools are also encouraged to conduct workshops and health checkups.

title: 'Army fully destroyed military infra in PoK's Leepa Valley during Op Sindoor'
content: The Indian Army's Chinar Corps executed Operation Sindoor, decimating military infrastructure in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir's Leepa Valley, including posts, ammunition depots, and fuel storage. Officials estimate it will take Pakistan 8-12 months to rebuild, following retaliation for ceasefire violations. India also destroyed nine terror camps in Pakistan and PoK in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 5 dead in 36 hours: Relentless rains leave Bengaluru gasping for relief
content: Bengaluru grappled with severe disruptions due to continuous heavy rainfall, leading to widespread waterlogging and traffic congestion. Tragically, rain-related incidents caused five fatalities, including electrocutions and a wall collapse. The IMD issued an orange alert for Bengaluru, anticipating further heavy rainfall and advising residents to take precautions, while authorities worked to evacuate and assist affected communities.

title: 'Spy ring': Kolkata influencer says Jyoti showed no interest in security sites
content: A Kolkata-based social media influencer, currently under scrutiny, has disclosed his interactions with YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra, arrested for alleged espionage for Pakistan's ISI. He met Malhotra during her Kolkata visit in February, following an initial encounter at the Ram Temple inauguration in Ayodhya.

title: If Shubman Gill is India's next Test captain, who will be his deputy?
content: With Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli stepping away from Test cricket, the leadership mantle is up for grabs. Shubman Gill is poised to take over as Test captain, but it comes with a rider - who will be his deputy, a designated vice-captain, captain-in-waiting, or, in Indian cricketing history, a powerless foot-soldier.

title: Abhishek Banerjee to represent TMC in all-party delegation on Operation Sindoor
content: Following discussions between parliamentary affairs minister Kiren Rijiju and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee, the Trinamool Congress has nominated Abhishek Banerjee to represent the party in parliamentary delegations related to Operation Sindoor. This decision follows Banerjee's emphasis on the need for inclusive consultations in selecting delegation members. He also suggested including family members of martyrs and officers involved in Operation Sindoor.

title: BJP takes 'nishan-e-Pakistan' jibe at Rahul Gandhi; Congress hits back
content: Bharatiya Janata Party criticized Congress leader Rahul Gandhi. The criticism is regarding Gandhi's remarks on Operation Sindoor. BJP accused Gandhi of echoing Pakistan's views. Amit Malviya shared an image linking Gandhi to Pakistan's military chief. Gandhi questioned the government about Indian aircraft losses. He alleged a forewarning to Pakistan. The Ministry of External Affairs rejected Gandhi's claims.

title: Punjab woman declares husband in US ‚Äòdead‚Äô for property
content: In Punjab's Jalandhar, a woman, along with the village sarpanch and a panchayat member, has been booked for allegedly attempting to obtain a false death certificate for her husband. Kuldeep Singh, who emigrated to the US via the 'dunki route' in 1998, never returned to India due to residency issues.

title: How snakes digest food: Understanding structural differences from humans
content: Snakes and humans exhibit significant differences in their digestive systems due to their distinct diets and lifestyles. Snakes possess flexible jaws, potent stomach acids, and a slow digestion process adapted for consuming large prey whole. In contrast, humans have rigid jaws, rely on chewing, and digest food more rapidly with a consistently active digestive system.

title: 'Operated by foreign-based handlers': Pak-backed terror module busted in Punjab
content: Punjab Police busted a Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) terror module in Batala, arresting six members after a shootout. The module, backed by Pakistan's ISI, operated under foreign-based handlers Maninder Billa and Mannu Agwan, directed by Harwinder Singh Rinda. The arrested individuals were involved in grenade attacks, logistics, and financing.

title: Restrictions on Dubai gold: India tightens gold and silver imports from UAE
content: India has tightened import rules on gold and silver from the UAE, targeting unwrought, semi-manufactured, and powdered forms. The move, following the Budget 2025 announcement, aims to prevent misuse of the India-UAE CEPA by importers who mislabel gold as platinum alloy to exploit lower duties.

title: 'It's been challenging': Sanjiv Goenka on LSG's elimination
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive half-century and Heinrich Klaasen's composed innings propelled Sunrisers Hyderabad to a six-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants, eliminating LSG from playoff contention. Despite Mitchell Marsh and Aiden Markram's fifties setting a strong foundation, Lucknow's late-over collapse proved costly. SRH successfully chased down the target, marking their first 200-plus chase at the Ekana Stadium.

title: Did US threaten to 'abandon' Israel if it continues war in Gaza?
content: Citing an unnamed source familiar with the talks, the Washington Post said that US officials have told Israel it could lose American backing if the conflict does not stop. "Trump's people are letting Israel know, 'We will abandon you if you do not end this war,'" the source was quoted as saying by the Washington Post.

title: 'Unseen, unstoppable': IAF showcases combat prowess, precision strikes in new video
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) released a video showcasing Operation Sindoor, its response to a Pakistan-backed terror attack in Pahalgam that killed 26. The IAF conducted precision strikes on terror-linked sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, including Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba locations. Pakistan retaliated, leading to further IAF strikes on radar installations and airbases.

title: What is Stablecoin Regulation Bill? US Senate advances cryptocurrency legislation
content: The US Senate has moved forward with the Genius Act, a bill designed to regulate stablecoins. Despite Democratic concerns about President Trump's potential conflicts of interest due to his cryptocurrency ventures, the bill passed a key procedural vote. It introduces comprehensive regulations for stablecoins, including reserve requirements and consumer protections.

title: Akshay Kumar to sue Paresh Rawal for walking out of ‚ÄòHera Pheri 3‚Äô: Report
content: The comedy sequel 'Hera Pheri 3' faces a twist. Paresh Rawal, known as Baburao, left the film. Akshay Kumar's company, Cape of Good Films, sent Rawal a legal notice for Rs 25 crore. They claim Rawal quit unprofessionally after signing and starting the shoot. Rawal denies creative differences. Fans are upset about Rawal's exit. Filming began in April with Priyadarshan directing.

title: 300km viaduct completed: Sneak peek into India‚Äôs first bullet train project - Watch
content: India's first bullet train project, connecting Mumbai and Ahmedabad, has achieved a significant milestone with 300 km of viaduct work completed, announced Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. The project, executed by NHSRCL, also includes the completion of a 350-meter mountain tunnel and the installation of India's first reinforced concrete track bed using Japanese Shinkansen technology.

title: 'It was a huge threat': Army destroys live Pakistani shell in J&K's Poonch
content: The Indian Army's bomb disposal squad safely detonated a live shell fired from Pakistan near a village in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district, averting a potential disaster. Residents expressed relief and gratitude, highlighting the army's crucial role in safeguarding the community.

title: Spain Now Hit With Network Outage, Weeks After Nationwide Blackout
content: The outage also had serious implications for emergency services, disrupting access to the EU-wide emergency number 112 in several regions. Authorities quickly responded by issuing alternative contact numbers to ensure public safety.

title: Ashoka University Professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad Sent To 14-Day Judicial Custody Over Post On Op Sindoor
content: Ali Khan Mahmudabad, the Ashoka University professor, who was arrested for a social media post about Operation Sindoor, which critics say is far from objectionable, was on Tuesday sent to 14-day judicial custody.

title: Syria's Driest Winter In 7 Decades Triggers Severe Water Crisis In Damascus
content: Inside a mountain above the Syrian capital, Hassan Bashi walked through tunnels that used to be filled with water from a spring famous for its pure waters.

title: Ranya Rao Gets Bail In Gold Smuggling Case But Will Stay In Jail. Here's Why
content: Kannada actor Ranya Rao, who was arrested for smuggling gold bars worth Rs 14.56 crore in March, was granted bail by a special court on Tuesday.

title: 1 Killed, 5 Injured After Four-Storey Building Collapses In Thane
content: A slab collapse in a four story building in Thane District on Tuesday left one dead and five injured.

title: Rohingya Usurping Job Opportunities For Local Youth: Pawan Kalyan
content: The migration of Rohingya refugees is leading to unemployment for local youth and creating an internal security challenge, Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan has said

title: Visa Applications By Indians For Turkey, Azerbaijan Drop By 42%: Report
content: In the wake of recent geopolitical developments that shifted Indian traveler sentiment dramatically, there has been a sharp 42 per cent decline in visa applications to Turkey and Azerbaijan, a report said on Tuesday.

title: "Who Asks For Proof Of Religion?" Waqf Law Challenged In Supreme Court
content: The creation of Waqf is not a secular process but a Muslim's dedication of property to God, Senior Advocate Kapil Sibal told the Supreme Court today, arguing against inclusion of non-Muslim members in Waqf bodies as laid down in Waqf Amendment Act

title: Why MAGA Activist Laura Loomer Has Found Herself At Odds With Donald Trump
content: In the past few weeks, Loomer has criticised the new pope, mounted a campaign against Trump's pick for surgeon general, Casey Means, blasted his attorney general, Pam Bondi, and objected to Trump's diplomatic efforts during his Middle East trip.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Why Operation Sindoor Will Be Studied The World Over
content: While brief in duration compared to the grinding wars of Eastern Europe and the Middle East, the significance of Sindoor lies in the speed, sophistication, and multi-domain nature of Indias military and political response.

title: Southern States Remain Soft Targets For Terrorism, Claims Pawan Kalyan
content: Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Pawan Kalyan on Tuesday claimed that southern states remain soft targets for terrorism, recalling past attacks in Hyderabad and Coimbatore as reminders of ongoing threats that demand continuous vigilance.

title: All About Wendy McMahon, Who Quit As CEO Of CBS News Amid US Admin Pressure
content: Wendy McMahon has stepped down as CBS News CEO, citing a "challenging" past few months, as the network faces mounting legal and political pressure from the Trump administration.

title: Google Decided Against Offering Publishers Options In AI Search
content: Google decided to "silently update," with "no public announcement" about how they were using publishers' data, according to the document, written by Chetna Bindra, a product management executive at Google Search

title: "Courts Cannot Intervene Unless...": Chief Justice's Big Remark On Waqf Law
content: There is a presumption of constitutionality in legislation that clears Parliament and courts cannot interfere unless a glaring case is made out, Chief Justice of India BR Gavai told the petitioners challenging the Waqf Amendment Act today.

title: "Bilawal Bhutto Better At Dancing, Should Focus On That": BJP's Jay Panda
content: The Centre's decision to send delegations abroad to brief world powers on Operation Sindoor and expose Pakistan is part of an ongoing reset in India's response to terrorism, senior BJP leader Baijayant 'Jay' Panda has said.

title: Intelligence Bureau Chief Tapan Deka Gets A Year's Extension For 2nd Time
content: Intelligence Bureau chief Tapan Kumar Deka, a counter-terrorism expert, has been given a one-year extension for the second time.

title: World Press Photo Pauses Credit For Napalm Girl, Historic Vietnam War Image
content: One of the most haunting images of the Vietnam War may not have been taken by the photographer it has long been credited to.

title: Portugals Ruling Party Wins General Election, Fall Short Of Majority
content: Portugal's third general election in three years has failed to deliver the result that could break the worst spell of political instability for decades.Sunday's vote delivered more uncertainty.

title: Woman Sues Husband For Defamation Over Adultery Charge. What Court Ruled
content: A Delhi Court has recently declined cognisance of a defamation complaint filed by a woman against her husband. The man had filed a divorce petition in Karnataka on the grounds of cruelty and adultery.

title: "Assassination Gear": Trump Ally Hits Out At Amazon For Selling '8647' Caps
content: The controversy around the number began when former FBI Director James Comey posted a photo on Instagram of a shell arrangement that appeared to spell out "8647", which according to Trump supporters was a hint at Trump assassination.

content: Ruben Amorim has been working 14-hour days at united's carrington training ground . the club have reached historically low depths that have left him "really embarrassed" if they beat Spurs at Estadio Salinas, they will face Tottenham in the Europa League final .

title: Free agency and draft plans for Maple Leafs, Capitals, every other eliminated team
content: the 2024-25 NHL regular season is over and the playoffs are underway . this is the place where we look ahead to the offseason for all the eliminated teams . read on for a look at what went wrong for each eliminated team .

title: Eight things we learned from the WNBA's opening weekend
content: the 2025 WNBA season is off and running . there's only so much to take away from a small sample size of games to begin the grind . some slow starts can turn around -- see the Fever last season making the playoffs after opening 1-8 .

title: Stanley Cup conference finals preview: Goalie confidence ratings, X factors for NHL's final four
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs field is down to the final four . the Carolina Hurricanes and Florida Panthers face off in a rematch of the 2023 Eastern Conference finals . a return bout from 2024 between the Dallas Stars and Edmonton Oilers .

title: QB tiers for every FBS program: Returning stars and, of course, Arch Manning
content: 2025 is the unofficial end point of the bonus year . if you're Diego Pavia, who might play until he's eligible to collect social security . some of last season's rules allowed players to stick around for five, six or even seven years .
